title: Drawing, "Ceres", ca. 1810
medium: Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed inside the octagon: cerere; Bacco.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Ceres shown sitting upon chair, holding with her right hand cornucopia and with left, reins of pair of snakes. Lion stands at left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ceres", ca. 1810.
ca. 1810. Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3268.
